meanings.definition: A person who is not directly involved in an activity or situation.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the sideliner watched from afar, not participating.
meanings.sent2: The sideliner stood on the sidelines, observing but not joining in.
meanings.sent3: The sideliner decided to sit out the game and enjoy some snacks instead.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a sideliner in the bustling crowd, just an observer.
meanings.sent5: The sideliner's role was to watch and learn, not to take action.

meanings.definition: A player who is not a regular member of a team but is available as a substitute.
meanings.sent1: The coach called in the sideliner to replace an injured player.
meanings.sent2: The sideliner warmed up on the sidelines, ready to jump into the game.
meanings.sent3: The sideliner was thrilled to get a chance to play and show their skills.
meanings.sent4: Being a sideliner meant always being prepared to step in at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The sideliner's moment to shine came when the star player got injured.

meanings.definition: A journalist or commentator who provides analysis or commentary from the sidelines.
meanings.sent1: The sideliner shared insightful comments on the game during the broadcast.
meanings.sent2: As a sideliner, he offered expert analysis from a different perspective.
meanings.sent3: The sideliner's witty remarks added a touch of humor to the serious commentary.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a sideliner in the world of sports journalism, observing from afar.
meanings.sent5: The sideliner's commentary was always on point, providing valuable insights.
